Recently a visible renaissance is taking place where intelligent, provocative and series color is being used to serve form and function and take a leading role in architectural environments. All projects featured in this book were completed between 2004 to 2008 clearly illustrating this resurgence over a very short period of time. We have, for now, put aside our chromophobia, replacing the archromic facades of the last several decades with polychromatic celebration of a new technology. What is most intriguing about this collection of projects is the diversity of materials and application. Colour has become wholly integrated into the construction process with a vast array of techniques. Rather than a secondary afterthought, chromaticity is considered through materials, surface, light and finish at an early stage in the design process.
